Package colorgen

Class ColorGen

java.lang.Object
colorgen.ColorGen
public class ColorGen
extends java.lang.Object
This class provides static functions for color gereration

    • randomRGB

      public static int[] randomRGB()
      get a random RGB color
      Returns:
      an array of int [R, G, B] in range of 0 - 255

    • colorDistance

      public static float colorDistance​(int[] color1, int[] color2)
      caculate the weighted Euclidean distance of two RGB colors
      Parameters:
      color1 - int array representing the first color, [R, G, B] range from 0 - 255;
      color2 - int array representing the second color, [R, G, B] range from 0 - 255;
      Returns:
      float, the distance between two color

    • colorDistanceUnweightedRGB

      public static float colorDistanceUnweightedRGB​(int[] color1, int[] color2)
      caculate the unweighted Euclidean distance of two RGB colors
      Parameters:
      color1 - int array representing the first color, [R, G, B] range from 0 - 255
      color2 - int array representing the second color, [R, G, B] range from 0 - 255
      Returns:
      float, the distance between two color

    • colorDistanceHSB

      public static float colorDistanceHSB​(float[] color1, float[] color2)
      caculate the unweighted Euclidean distance of two HSB colors in the HSB cone
      Parameters:
      color1 - float array representing the first color, [H, S, B] range from 0 - 1;
      color2 - float array representing the second color, [H, S, B] range from 0 - 1;
      Returns:
      float, the distance between two color

    • randomOffsetRGB

      public static int[] randomOffsetRGB​(int[] baseColor, float offset)
      generate random offset color based on a chosen color
      Parameters:
      baseColor - int array representing the chosen color, [R, G, B] range from 0 - 255
      offset - float the max offset
      Returns:
      int array representing the generated color, [R, G, B] range from 0 - 255

    • HSBtoRGB

      public static int[] HSBtoRGB​(float hue, float sat, float bri)
      Cover HSB color (0-1 range) to RGB color (0-255), this is based on the function in java.awt.Color
      Parameters:
      hue - float, 0-1
      sat - float, 0-1
      bri - float, 0-1
      Returns:
      int array representing the corresponding RGB color

    • RGBtoHSB

      public static float[] RGBtoHSB​(int red, int green, int blue)
      convert RGB (0-255) to HSB (0-1), base on the function in java.awt.Color
      Parameters:
      red - int, between 0 - 255
      green - int, between 0 - 255
      blue - int, between 0 - 255
      Returns:
      a float array representing the HSB color

    • gradientRGB

      public static int[][] gradientRGB​(int n, float from, float to, java.lang.String type)

    • gradientRGB

      public static int[][] gradientRGB​(int n, float from, float to, java.lang.String type, float sat, float bri)
      generate a bunch of color in gradient, take different type
      Parameters:
      n - the number of color return
      from - the starting point of the gradient (0 - 1)
      to - the end point of the gradient (0 - 1)
      type - how the colors are picked. "UR": Uniform Random, randomly select values between 0 and 1, and map this to the gradient to select colours. "G": Grid, uniform sections, no two colours will be closer to each other(along the gradient) than 1/n. "JG": Jittered Grid, grid with random offset. "GR" Golden Ratio, using golden ratio.
      sat - optional, satuation value between 0 - 1, defalut to 1
      bri - optional, brightness value between 0 - 1, defalut to 1
      Returns:
      an array of rbg colors

    • standerHarmonyColorRGB

      public static int[][] standerHarmonyColorRGB​(int n, float range1, float range2, float range3)

    • standerHarmonyColorRGB

      public static int[][] standerHarmonyColorRGB​(int n, float range1, float range2, float range3, float reference, float sat, float bri, float offset1, float offset2)
      Generate a bunch of color according to the stander harmony color scheme, see http://doi.acm.org/10.1145/1179352.1141933
      Parameters:
      n - number of the colors
      range1 - float, range angle 1 in the hue ring
      range2 - float, range angle 2 in the hue ring
      range3 - float, range angle 3 in the hue ring
      reference - optional, float, as the reference hue for generation, default is random
      sat - optional, float (0 - 1), sat value, default to 1
      bri - optional, float (0 - 1), bri value, default to 1
      offset1 - optional, float, offset amount 1, default 0, must between 0 - 1
      offset2 - optional, float, offset amount 2, default 0, must between 0 - 1
      Returns:
      an array of color in RGB format

    • analogousColorRGB

      public static int[][] analogousColorRGB​(int n, float range)

    • analogousColorRGB

      public static int[][] analogousColorRGB​(int n, float range, float ref, float sat, float bri, float offset1, float offset2)
      Generate a bunch of color according to the analogous color scheme
      Parameters:
      n - number of colors
      range - range of color
      ref - optional, reference angle, default is random
      sat - optional, float, 0 - 1, default to 1
      bri - optional, float, 0 - 1, default to 1
      offset1 - optional, float, offset amount 1, default 0, must between 0 - 1
      offset2 - optional, float, offset amount 2, default 0, must between 0 - 1
      Returns:
      an array of colors in RGB format

    • complementaryColorRGB

      public static int[][] complementaryColorRGB​(int n, float range1, float range2)

    • complementaryColorRGB

      public static int[][] complementaryColorRGB​(int n, float range1, float range2, float ref, float sat, float bri, float offset2)
      Generate a bunch of color according to the complementary color scheme
      Parameters:
      n - number of colors
      range1 - range1
      range2 - range2
      ref - optional, reference angle, default is random
      sat - optional, float, 0 - 1, default to 1
      bri - optional, float, 0 - 1, default to 1
      offset2 - optional, float, offset amount 2, default 0, must between 0 - 1
      Returns:
      an array of colors in RGB format

    • splitcomplementaryColorRGB

      public static int[][] splitcomplementaryColorRGB​(int n, float range1, float range2, float range3, float var)

    • splitcomplementaryColorRGB

      public static int[][] splitcomplementaryColorRGB​(int n, float range1, float range2, float range3, float var, float ref, float sat, float bri)
      Generate a bunch of color according to the split complementary color scheme
      Parameters:
      n - number of colors
      range1 - range1
      range2 - range2, must smaller than 2*var
      range3 - range3, must smaller than 2*var
      var - variation from 180 for the offset values
      ref - optional, reference angle, default is random
      sat - optional, float, 0 - 1, default to 1
      bri - optional, float, 0 - 1, default to 1
      Returns:
      an array of colors in RGB format

    • triadColorRGB

      public static int[][] triadColorRGB​(int n, float range1, float range2, float range3)

    • triadColorRGB

      public static int[][] triadColorRGB​(int n, float range1, float range2, float range3, float ref, float sat, float bri)
      Generate a bunch of color according to the traid color scheme
      Parameters:
      n - number of colors
      range1 - float, range1
      range2 - float, range2
      range3 - float, range3
      ref - optional, reference angle, default is random
      sat - optional, float, 0 - 1, default to 1
      bri - optional, float, 0 - 1, default to 1
      Returns:
      an array of colors in RGB format

    • triadMixingRGB

      public static int[] triadMixingRGB​(int[] color1, int[] color2, int[] color3, float greyControl)
      mix 3 color to get a new one, use the greyControl to control the grey value (0:low - 1:high)
      Parameters:
      color1 - first color to mix
      color2 - second color to mix
      color3 - third color to mix
      greyControl - 0-1, how much grey get mix in
      Returns:
      a color in RGB format

    • yiq

      public static boolean yiq​(int[] color)
      YIQ color contrast calculation, returning black or white determination of optimal foreground color
      Parameters:
      color - the foreground color
      Returns:
      boolean, true for black(dark color) and false for white(bright color)

    • to24BitRGB

      public static int to24BitRGB​(int[] c)
      cast the color array to 24 bit int RGB color
      Parameters:
      c - the color array [R, G, B]
      Returns:
      int

    • to32BitARGB

      public static int to32BitARGB​(int[] c)
      cast the color array to 32 bit int ARGB color
      Parameters:
      c - the color array [R, G, B, A]
      Returns:
      int

    • to32BitARGB

      public static int to32BitARGB​(int[] c, int a)
      cast the color array to 32 bit int ARGB color
      Parameters:
      c - the color array [R, G, B]
      a - the alpha value between 0 - 255
      Returns:
      int

      parse 24bit or 32bit color and output it as an array, only RGB value is exported

      Returns:
